alert.note: Alert for Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 6:33PM EDT until September 11 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Colleton. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro, Cottageville, Ritter, Hendersonville, Green Pond, White Hall, Ashepoo, Round O, Jacksonboro, Drawdy, Thayer, Lowcountry Regional Airport, Colleton Medical Center, Neyles, Rhodes Crossroads, Stokes, Gloverville and Hiotts.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
